instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SHOWS LOW BATTERY SIGN NO POWER
threads.message:
Good day, guys. 

I hope I get help with this one, this is new for me on this line, I have only encountered this issue on older designs pre-2018 Mac Line-Ups. When I connect the charger, I get a low battery sign on the screen, but that's about it, with or without the battery connected, I get the same battery low sign, and the unit will not power or go past that stage. One thing I have noticed is that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is not present, even when I get the low battery sign, this rail is not present, I am bent towards replacing <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, but am not sure if that is a good troubleshooting cause of action. Please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SHOWS LOW BATTERY SIGN NO POWER
threads.message:
Use original 87/96W charger and tell us what happens.
Also connect known good battery.
